title: (x) 1930's or 40's German street signs - FF City Street Type {Yves}
content:
1930’s or 40’s? German street signs. What is that font? I’ve been rolling through fonts but it seems I can’t find a font that has that same “feel”. I can find a lot like it but I think it will “click” when I see it :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [streetsigns-TYPO.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/files/streetsigns-TYPO.jpg) | 189.02 KB |

 [‹ (x) Saratoga Lanes script - Brody {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/node/15525 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) extended sans WebTrends - Trade Gothic Extd {Ben} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/node/15522 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tim Cuccolo

comments.content: [Verena Gerlach](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Verena%252BGerlach) and [Ole Schäfer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ole%252BSch%2525C3%2525A4fer) have digitised those faces as [FF City Street Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11197.0.0) for the [FontFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050846/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontFont) library.
